column1: ancaBoth the forms anka and anca occur in the published The Etymologies (cf.
column4: in the corrigenda to The Etymologies
column5: it is suggested that Christopher Tolkien had made a misreading of the original manuscript or that a printing error had occurred: the form used in both places is actually anka (cf.
column6: p. 5). Although this is the only attested occurrence of anka/anca
column7: the latter form is used on Tolkien Gateway in order to have a regularized Quenya spelling (c for k
column8: in line with Helge Fauskangers use in http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/wordlists.htm Quettaparma Quenyallo (Quenya Wordlists (accessed 29 November 2010). is a noun meaning "jaws" in Quenya.

column1: Image:Anca.gifAnca is also the name in Quenya of the fifteenth letter of the Tengwar alphabet.  It is the third letter of the fourth grade or Tyellë
column2: which contains "voiced spirants" and it is the fourth letter in the third series of consonants
column3: which for Quenya and Sindarin was the k-series
column4: the Calmatéma.  In the standard spelling of Quenya this letter represents NC or NK while in Sindarin this letter represents GH.  In Westron
column5: the third series is used for a variety of consonantal sounds and this letter represents ZH.  The Westron name for this letter is Izhe.See Westron Tengwar

column1: The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme ÁNAK.
* http://www.uib.no/People/hnohf/qlist.htm Quenya Corpus Wordlist edited by Helge Fauskanger
